A.text: Your concern for damaging foe hinders you.

C.text: Your concern for foe is heart warming.

D.text: Nothing graceful about this attack. Foe does not even flinch.

E.text: Strike to neck pinches a nerve. What did you do to him? Foe is unconscious.

B.text: You're being too delicate. Bust him!

C.text: You will need to make a fist.

E.text: You simply hit foe in the face.

B.text: Your strike lands on foe's shoulder. Attack is of little profit.

C.text: Blow to foe's chest. If foe is 2 feet tall or shorter, he is unconscious.

D.text: Blow to foe's chest. If foe is 3 feet tall or shorter, he is unconscious.

E.text: Boom! Crash! Pow! Crack! It looked impressive.

A.text: Foe's guard comes up and blocks your assault.

B.text: You attempt to kick foe in groin. You miss, but the threat is enough.

C.text: Side strike unbalances foe. He will recover quickly.

D.text: Blow to foe's side sends him reeling. He recovers and gets his guard up.

E.text: Strike to foe's side. Cheap shot, executed with grace.

B.text: You miss foe's head and strike his shoulder. He is unbalanced.

C.text: Chest strike. He almost falls, but foe grabs you for balance. Ooops!

D.text: You trip foe and slam his shin. Simple, yet effective.

E.text: Foe leaves himself open. Your strike hits his side and breaks some ribs.

A.text: Move in close. You gain the initiative next round.

B.text: Blow lands on foe's shield hand. You gain the initiative.

C.text: You entangle foe's legs, but he breaks free. You push him clear.

D.text: Step on foe's foot and try to push him over. You gain the initiative next round.

E.text: You experiment with a knee strike to foe. It fails to be very effective.

A.text: Strike to foe's chest. He is having some trouble.

B.text: Back strike. Your position is better. Foe seeks to keep you at bay.

C.text: Lower back strike sends foe reeling. He needs another shot to the kidneys.

D.text: Back strike adds insult to the injury. Foe spins around to face you.

E.text: Hard shot to foe's side causes a pain generated panic. His guard is down.

A.text: Stike falls on foe's leg. He shakes it off.

B.text: Your strike was less than you hoped. It still disorients your foe.

C.text: Hammer foe's thigh. Pain is in his eyes. Bruise muscles.

D.text: Chest strike causes deep bruise. Foe grabs at the pain in his chest.

E.text: Chest wound knocks foe down. He lands on his back.. He looks to be recovering.

A.text: Blow lightly strikes foe's head. He puts you at bay with a masterful turn.

B.text: Shoulder strike lands lightly. You put more shove into it than strike. Foe is frantic to regain his balance.

C.text: Good strike. Foe has trouble getting his act together. He stumbles around for some time trying to defend himself.

D.text: Hard blow to foe's thigh. Foe falls down, but rebounds to his feet. You had hoped he would stay down.

E.text: Solid and strong, you bash foe in his stomach. He recoils 10 feet from you. He keeps his footing.

A.text: Backhand to foe's side. He steps 5 feet to the right, avoiding your reach.

B.text: Hard blow to foe's side. He is weakened by the pain. He doubles over in response to the assault.

C.text: You grip foe's arm and shake it until he drops his weapon. Foe kicks himself free. At least you disarmed him.

D.text: Catch foe in the middle of a swing. He drops his weapon and grips his arm. His forearm has a huge bruise.

E.text: Solid and effective, your blow lands on foe's neck. A nerve is pinched. Foe falls unconscious for 3 hours.

A.text: Classic shot between foe's shoulder blades. He hurts.

B.text: Grab foe's weapon arm and force it the wrong way. Foe is disarmed. Elbow is strained.

C.text: Bring foe down to his knees and slam his head down. He is virtually unconscious. He is yours. Finish him.

D.text: Solid strike to foe's head. The strike is enough to knock foe out. He falls down and out for 6 hours.

E.text: Brutal, but effective shot to foe's face. His head snaps back and then flops forward. He falls unconscious.

A.text: Chest strike is solid. Knock the wind out of your foe. He struggles to evade.

B.text: Strong forearm assault drives foe back off his footing. He slips down to one knee.

C.text: Strong blow to foe's chest breaks ribs. Your attack has little grace. Foe looks to be devastated.

D.text: Smash foe's shoulder, breaking it. Arm is useless. Foe struggles to stand. The pain is too much for him.

E.text: You attack lands unexpectedly on foe's shoulder. It is fractured. Foe drops his guard in response to the pain.

A.text: Side strike damages a muscle. Foe is disabled for the moment.

B.text: You try to kick foe off his feet. The strike lands on foe's calf. Deep bruise.

C.text: You assault foe's foot. He is unable to stand on it.

D.text: Leg strike causes foe to fall and fracture his leg.

E.text: Strike to foe's thigh causes him to fall. Blow creates a terrible bruise.

A.text: Blow to foe's shield arm. If foe has a shield, it should check for breakage.

B.text: Heavy handed attack. It looks like you're going for a kill. Foe avoids the worst. Blow to foe's shield arm.

C.text: Strike to foe's arm causes him to fall with a fracture. You punch at his head for added effect.

D.text: Strong blow to foe's weapon arm disarms him and causes him to fall. He lands hard and breaks a rib.

E.text: Fierce blow to foe's weapon arm disarms him and sends him sprawling. You have his weapon.

A.text: Strong grip and a shot to the side make for an effective combination. Foe is disabled for an instant.

B.text: Side strike knocks foe down. He pulls you over with him. You fail to pummel him into submission. You have a great position.

C.text: Strong blow to foe's side. Foe drops his weapon to react to the pain. You move to block him from its recovery. Foe gives ground with little concern.

D.text: Strike to foe's side sends him to the ground. While falling, he fractures his ankle. Foe goes unconscious from the pain.

E.text: Side strike knocks foe down. You hit him in the face as he falls. In the fall, he breaks his leg.

A.text: Your attack is part grapple and sweep. You push foe off balance.

B.text: Hard strike to the back of foe's neck terminates foe's conscious thoughts. He drops. Foe's shoulder blade is bruised.

C.text: Strong blow to foe's back knocks him off his feet. Foe lands hard and is knocked out by the impact. You have him now.

D.text: Blow to foe's back knocks him to the ground. His weapon slides across the floor. He hit very hard. Foe goes unconscious for 5 rounds.

E.text: Nasty blow to face. Foe is knocked down. Foe's lips curl up in a ball and froth comes out of his mouth. You are frightened. Foe goes unconscious.

A.text: Strike lands solid upon foe's neck. His neck is sprained. He falls down and has difficulty getting up.

B.text: Your knuckles go into foe's temples and cause a painful overload to foe's brain. He falls gripping his head for 2 rounds and passes out.

C.text: Overwhelming blow knocks foe down. He fumbles his weapon and hits hard trying to recover it. Foe goes unconscious on impact.

D.text: Grip foe's arm and hold it, while striking him in the face until he goes unconscious. Foe is unconscious for 15 rounds.

E.text: Strike to shoulder breaks the collar bone. Foe knocks himself out with a graceless fall. You strike his head to make sure.

A.text: Solid strike turns foe's head and it pinches a nerve in his neck. Foe falls over and goes unconscious.

B.text: Fracture foe's skull with a lucky strike. Foe falls unconscious. The swelling will kill him in 2 hours.

C.text: Blow lands on foe's forehead. His head snaps back and he loses consciousnes. He then drops hard on the ground and hits his head.

D.text: Strong blow to the abdomen causes foe to fall to the ground. He hits his head. Foe goes into a coma for 1 month.

E.text: Your haste to get the advantage makes your attack deadly. You snap foe's neck. Foe falls and dies in 15 rounds.

A.text: You pop foe on his head in what looks like a playful strike. He pauses 1 round, then passes out.

B.text: Strong blow to foe's back knocks him down and paralyzes him. Serious nerve damage. Foe is unconscious.

C.text: Severe chest strike. Foe falls, breaking his arm and hitting his head. He goes into a coma for 2 weeks.

D.text: Pummel foe's head. He falls unconscious in a nice spot on the ground.

E.text: Textbook subdual. You strike foe on his head. He settles to the ground in a silent move. He is unconscious for 10 hours.
